description.narrative: Oxfam: Oxfam is a leading organization in emergency WaSH and Food Security in Mozambique since 1987. Over the past five years Oxfam has implemented WaSH responses to benefit flood-affected populations in Sofala and Zambezia, cholera-affected populations in Sofala and Niassa, WaSH activities for east African refugees in Cabo Delgado and Nampula, and EFSL response for populations affected by three consecutive years of drought in Gaza. In Mozambique Oxfam uses a single programmatic approach, linking activities in sustainable livelihoods, humanitarian assistance, good governance and gender for amore effective impact on beneficiaries. In 2013, in coordination with COSACA members, Oxfam with its local partners implemented an emergency intervention to benefit more than 32,000 people in nine of the most flood-affected communities in Gaza and 8,000people in Zambezia province through seeds and tools fairs, food security (EFSL) and access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene promotion (WASH). The total funding mobilized was $2 million from the Oxfam co-federation network and two bilateral donors.

participating-org.narrative: MAHLAHLE - Assoc. Promoç. Des. da M

MAHLAHLE is a Mozambican non-profit organization that aims at reducing social inequalities thru supporting the most vulnerable groups, specialy women and children. In its approach MAHLAHLE works in the neediest rural communities of Inhambane province implementingsocial and economic development projects.
MAHLAHLE intervention is guided by its 2008-13 Strategic Plan informed by social and economic studies done in whole Inhambane province with the active participation of communities and Local Government that defined six priority areas (Agriculture and Food Security, Increment of Household Income, Formal and Non-formal Education, HIV and AIDS, Emergencyrelief and Advocacy). Partnership is the leading implementation strategy for achieving the Mahlahle aim.For project implementation,MAHLAHLE encourages the creation of community mutual help groups that apart from the project activities they carry out other community activities.
The liaison between beneficiaries and MAHLAHLE is done thru community structures in a form of Project Implementation Committees and Community Based Organizations supported by agriculture and veterinary promoters, HIV and AIDS activists, and WASHanimators. MAHLAHLE promotes economic and social empowerment of women and youth thrutraining in vocational activities. Participation of women in different decision making forums and their alphabetization are also stimulated.
Most of the activities supported by MAHLAHLE prioritize the use of locally available resources and as most of thetarget group does agriculture as their main livelihood activitiy, the projects aim at improving the value chain with special emphasis to introduction of production technologies adaptable to different climate conditions, reduction of post harvest losses,agroprocessing and support to agriculture comercialization.
In allMahlahle implemented projects Gender, HIV and AIDS, Environmental Protection, Promotion and Protection of Children#s Rights are crosscutting issues. To widen the impact of project activites, Mahlahle built and is managing two community radios in Massinga and Funhalouro districts .
